alert.note: Alert for Grays Harbor (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 07 at 8:03AM PST until December 08 at 10:33PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Snoqualmie River Near Carnation affecting King County. Chehalis River Above Grand Mound affecting Thurston and Grays Harbor Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Chehalis River At Porter affecting Grays Harbor County. .Light rain will continue to move over the region today but is not expected to impact flood levels. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Chehalis River at Porter. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 48.0 feet, the Chehalis River in Grays Harbor will flood low pasture lands and some roads. High tidal levels at Aberdeen will worsen flooding along the lower reaches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 AM PST Thursday the stage was 48.4 feet. - Flood stage is 48.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:45 AM PST Thursday was 48.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 48.5 feet late this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 415 PM PST.
